content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This contibution is really cool and you have to have some skills in order to be able to solve it. I think it should really be accepted!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a good contribution, especially for fastest and shortest modes

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The solution to this puzzle is short enough and yet you need to think about the puzzle for a minute to figure out the optimal solution. I really like it.

Maybe it's just me but with this code:

crayons = list(map(int,input()))
c=0
for i in range(10):
    if crayons[i] != i:
        temp = crayons[i]
        crayons[i], crayons[temp] = crayons[temp], crayons[i]
        c += 1
print(c)

I pass every test but not validator 4. If I add a while:

crayons = list(map(int,input()))
c=0
while crayons != [i for i in range(10)]:
    for i in range(10):
        if crayons[i] != i:
            temp = crayons[i]
            crayons[i], crayons[temp] = crayons[temp], crayons[i]
            c += 1
print(c)

now it works, so I'd suggest to switch Validator 4 and Test 4, because only in Validator 4 it is tested that you need more than 1 round of "naive" permutations.

That aside, fun clash!
Good point! I slightly modified Test 4 so that this method doesn't work.
